Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(2) Summary

API programs exist in almost every organization, sometimes explicitly and sometimes implicitly. Even if you don't have an explicit API program yet, the success of all of your digital investments and activities still critically depends on how APIs are used and managed. Many organizations report that they are not perfectly happy with their API initiatives and programs. This talk presents patterns and anti-patterns for API programs. While using these for assessing your organization's API program does not guarantee success, they will help to improve the overall effectiveness of the program, and therefore will also help the larger digital transformation journey.

The Execution Gap Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(7) Vision → Strategy → Program → Results



The Execution Gap Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(8) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]



The Execution Gap Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(9) Leadership 1-2-3

  • Set a vision as the goal to improve the organization
    • Digital Transformation will help us to thrive in the increasingly digitalized world
  • Define a strategy how to turn the vision into reality
    • APIs are a necessary component of digital transformation
  • Have a program to turn the defined strategy into reality
    • Designing and building good APIs has business, organizational, and technical aspects


Boosters

Boosters Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(11) Landscape Diversity

  • Why are there certain guidelines for API practices?
  • What to do can change over time depending on requirements
  • How to do things can change over time depending on tools and techniques


Boosters Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(12) Product Mindset

  • Business: APIs are conceived as reusable building blocks
  • Technology: APIs are designed as reusable capabilities
  • Teams: APIs are managed with a full product lifecycle


Boosters Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(13) Lighthouse Projects

  • Demonstrate real value and not just potential value
  • Start small and improve and evolve your program and practices
  • Move the conversation from saving money to making money


Blockers

Outline (Blockers)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. The Execution Gap [3]
  3. Boosters [3]
  4. Blockers [3]
  5. Conclusions [2]
Blockers Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(15) Verticalized Capabilities

  • Projects over products means that there is little reuse
  • Investments into API tooling and platform could be more effective


Blockers Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(16) Missing Business Alignment

  • We have a whole bunch of APIs so we're doing well, right?
  • APIs may be hard to understand and hard to reuse


Blockers Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(17) Saving Money with APIs

  • Having a componentized architecture will save money
  • Main focus should be on capturing new opportunities
  • What does the strategy say about API goals?


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers

(19) Got Goals?

  • Have a mission for your API program
  • Have goals to check API progress
  • Start small but keep an eye on the big picture


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Program Success: Boosters and Blockers
